title: Kafka Connector Setup Instructions
helptext: Follow the below instructions to populate the required inputs needed for the connector correctly.

source_kafka_broker_servers.title: Kafka Brokers
source_kafka_broker_servers.description: Enter Kafka broker addresses in the format: broker1-hostname:port,broker2-hostname:port
source_kafka_broker_servers.helptext:
Kafka Broker Address Format: Enter the broker addresses in the following format:<broker1-hostname>:<port>,<broker2-hostname>:<port>,<broker3-hostname>:<port>

Example: broker1.example.com:9092,broker2.example.com:9092,broker3.example.com:9092

Ensure each brokers hostname and port are correct, separated by commas.

source_kafka_topic.title: Kafka Topic
source_kafka_topic.description: Enter Kafka topic name. Only alphanumeric characters, dots, dashes, and underscores are allowed.
source_kafka_topic.helptext:
Kafka Topic Name: Enter the name of the Kafka topic. Only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, 0-9), dots (.), dashes (-), and underscores (_) are allowed.

Example: example_topic-01

Ensure the topic name is clear and follows these character restrictions for compatibility with Kafka.

source_kafka_auto_offset_reset.title: Kafka Auto Offset Reset
source_kafka_auto_offset_reset.description: Select auto offset reset: earliest, latest, or none (default: earliest if unsure)
source_kafka_auto_offset_reset.helptext:
Kafka Auto Offset Reset: Determines where the consumer begins reading if thereâ€™s no previous offset or the offset is out of range.

Possible Values:

  • earliest - Start from the earliest message (default). If unsure, leave this as earliest.
  • latest - Start from the most recent message.
  • none - Throw an error if no previous offset is found.

source_kafka_consumer_id.title: Kafka Consumer Id
source_kafka_consumer_id.description: Enter Kafka consumer group ID (e.g., my_consumer_group_01)
source_kafka_consumer_id.helptext:
Kafka Consumer Group ID: Specify a unique identifier for the consumer group. This ID helps Kafka manage message consumption and track offsets across multiple consumers.

Note: Choose a meaningful name for easy tracking, as consumers with the same group ID share messages.

Example: my_consumer_group_01

source_kafka_ssl_enabled.title: Enable SSL for Kafka
source_kafka_ssl_enabled.description: Enable this option if the Kafka is configured to use SSL for secure communication.
source_kafka_ssl_enabled.helptext:
If enabled, ensure that all required SSL configuration properties are provided, such as:

  • ssl.keystore.location
  • ssl.keystore.password
  • ssl.key.password
  • ssl.truststore.location
  • ssl.truststore.password

These settings allow the Kafka source to establish a secure connection using SSL.

source_kafka_ssl_truststore_base64.title: Truststore File (Base64)
source_kafka_ssl_truststore_base64.description: Enter the Base64-encoded content of the truststore file.
source_kafka_ssl_truststore_base64.helptext:
Kafka SSL Truststore: Provide the contents of the truststore file encoded in Base64. This file helps ensure secure communication by verifying the Kafka broker's certificate.

Command to convert file content to base64:
base64 -i /path/to/truststore.jks | tr -d '\n'

source_kafka_ssl_keystore_base64.title: Keystore File (Base64)
source_kafka_ssl_keystore_base64.description: Enter the Base64-encoded content of the keystore file.
source_kafka_ssl_keystore_base64.helptext:
Kafka SSL Keystore: Provide the contents of the keystore file encoded in Base64. This file is required to authenticate the Kafka client securely during SSL handshake.

Command to convert file content to base64:
base64 -i /path/to/keystore.jks | tr -d '\n'

source_kafka_ssl_truststore_password.title: Truststore Password
source_kafka_ssl_truststore_password.description: Enter the password used to protect the truststore file.
source_kafka_ssl_truststore_password.helptext: Kafka SSL Truststore Password: Used to access the truststore, which verifies the SSL certificate presented by the Kafka broker.

source_kafka_ssl_keystore_password.title: Keystore Password
source_kafka_ssl_keystore_password.description: Enter the password used to protect the keystore file.
source_kafka_ssl_keystore_password.helptext: Kafka SSL Keystore Password: Used to unlock the keystore containing the client's SSL certificate and private key.

source_kafka_ssl_key_password.title: Key Password
source_kafka_ssl_key_password.description: Enter the password used to access the private key inside the keystore.
source_kafka_ssl_key_password.helptext: Kafka SSL Key Password: Used to decrypt the private key within the keystore for SSL client authentication.

source_data_format.title: Data Format
source_data_format.helptext:
Data Format: Select the format of the data stored in the kafka topic. Supported formats:

  • JSON: Standard JSON format, typically one object per file.{
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Alice",
      "email": "abc@xyz.com"
    }
  • JSONL: JSON Lines format with one JSON object per line, suitable for large datasets.{"id": 1, "name": "Alice", "email": "alice@example.com"}
    {"id": 2, "name": "Bob", "email": "bob@example.com"}
  • Parquet: A binary, columnar format optimized for efficient storage. Not human-readable.
  • CSV: Comma-separated values format for tabular data.id,name,email
    1,Alice,alice@example.com
    2,Bob,bob@example.com

Select the format that matches the data files in the bucket.
